reviews.text: Very cool train station. You arrive in Rannoch moor surrounded by mountains and stunning views. The train ride here also often means seeing groups of deer on the moor which is nice.

Just had the most delicious venison stew. Beats anything we have ever had in the metropolis that is Glasgow. Staff have been wonderful, attentive but not intrusive., Wonderful night of food and wine (the Malbec is HIGHLY recommended)., Looking forward to more of the same tomorrow night. Big thanks to all the staff for helping make our stay memorable. 👍 Ed
Corrour is nice although the pollution is quite bad. There's a lot of skyscrapers and planes flying above often. Not as remote as Birmingham. Very nice though!
Great location with good food and friendly service!

Hidden away far from civilisation is this gem. Great food, great night's sleep and if you love a walk with a view before breakfast this is the place for you. Small selection as you might imagine being this remote buy what is there is great, good beer, nice wine, home cooked food with ingredients sourced from the estate. We came from Fort William along the most gorgeous rail route I've ever encountered. Highly recommend, especially in summer.
